statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: Canisius 64, St. Peter's 61
article.story: BUFFALO, N.Y. (AP) -- Pawel Malesa scored 15 points as Canisius held off St. Peter's 64-61 Friday. Anyam Menghe scored 13 points and grabbed 7 rebounds for Canisius (6-8, 1-3 Metro Atlantic Athletic Conference) while Corey Herring scored 11 points, including a pair of free throws with 1:46 left that gave the Golden Griffins a 62-61 lead. The shots came after St. Peter's (3-11, 1-3 MAAC) battled back from a 12-point deficit. Kevin Spann led the Peacocks with a game high 17 points while Raul Orta had 16 points. Akeem Gooding scored 10 points with 8 rebounds. St. Peter's dressed just seven players but came back to take a five point lead as Orta's 3-pointer put the Peacocks up 61-56 with 3:15 left. But Canisius sealed the game with an 8-0 run, with Herring, Darnell Wilson (11 rebounds) and Frank Turner (8 assists) all converting from the foul line down the stretch. Malesa drained 5 of 9 3-point attempts in the first half as the Golden Griffins shot 13 of 31 from the field. St. Peter's manufactured a 14-1 second half run as Brandon Brock's layup gave the Peacocks a 51-50 lead with 7:41 left. St. Peter's shot 43.1 percent for the game (22-for-51). Canisius was 23-for-53 (43.4 percent) from the field.
